definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: Look, here comes a mutton chop with lots of gravy smeared on top.
sentences.chinese: 看哪，这是一个上面抹了很多肉酱的羊排。

sentences.english: So I wouldn't have to eat Daddy's sucky lamb chop.
sentences.chinese: 那样的话，我就不用吃爸爸烧的难吃的羊排了。

sentences.english: The western-style lamb chops are really succulent, invitingly giving off a sizzling sound.
sentences.chinese: 西式烤小羊排真很好吃，十分诱人地发出滋滋声响。

sentences.english: "I like the lamb chops and the salami," she said.
sentences.chinese: “我喜欢羊排和意大利香肠，”她说。

sentences.english: We have onion soup, beef steak , lamb chop, smoked salmon and lobster.
sentences.chinese: 我们有洋葱汤，牛排，羊排，烟熏三文鱼和龙虾。

sentences.english: Sprinkle some salt and pepper on both sides of each lamb chop, use chopper to press gently.
sentences.chinese: 在羊排正反两面洒上盐和胡椒，用刀背轻柔地压一下。

sentences.english: This lamb chop is too tough.
Suggested food pairings: beef, lamb, grilled salmon, hearty pastas.
sentences.chinese: 适于搭配牛肉，小羊排，烤三文鱼及意大利面。

sentences.english: I turn the proteininhis dinner lamb chop into amino acids.
sentences.chinese: 我把他晚餐吃的羊排里的蛋白质转变成氨基酸。

sentences.english: So did the fish frozen and the combination of lamb chops.
sentences.chinese: 所以做了鱼冻和羊排的结合。

definition: pork chop/pork cutlet/spare ribs/(coll.) skinny person
